snippet: Republican leaders say they can raise $800 billion in revenue in the first decade by limiting tax breaks, a proposal that analysts say is possible but bound to face political hurdles.
abstract: News analysis; House Republican leaders claim that their budget counteroffer can raise $800 billion in revenue within 10 years by limiting tax breaks, proposal that analysts say is possible but not easily achieved.
lead_paragraph: Republican leaders say they can raise $800 billion in revenue in the first decade by limiting tax breaks, a proposal that analysts say is possible but bound to face political hurdles.

headline.seo: Limiting Tax Deductions May Work, but Not Easily
headline.main: Tax Deduction Limits May Trim Deficits, but Not Easily
headline.print_headline: Limiting Deductions May Work, but Not Easily

keywords.value: Committee for a Responsible Federal Budget
